results.idea: Short-term momentum (5d) cross-sectional
results.description: Used SUGGESTION1 by using a high-coverage return field; SUGGESTION2 not applicable (field is scalar time series); SUGGESTION3 not needed (coverage=1.0); SUGGESTION4 applied (rsk62_1_return has very high userCount). Simple and widely-tested short-term momentum. Confidence set to 0.65 based on strong data coverage and literature.

results.idea: Medium-term momentum (20d) cross-sectional
results.description: Applied S1 by using returns; S2 not applied; S3 not needed; S4 used. Medium-term horizon to capture trend. Confidence 0.68 due to robust signal on return series.

results.idea: Long-term momentum (120d)
results.description: S1: uses returns; S2: not needed; S3: not needed; S4: rsk62_1_return high userCount supports stability. Long-term momentum often persistent. Confidence 0.6 (longer horizons can decay).

results.idea: Short-term reversal (mean-reversion) 5d negative momentum
results.description: S1: uses returns; S2: not applied; S3: not needed; S4 used. Reverse recent extreme returns expecting short-term reversion. Confidence 0.55 (reversal weaker than momentum).

results.idea: Volatility-adjusted momentum
results.description: S1: combined returns and volatility fields; S2: none; S3: not required; S4: both fields have high userCounts. I scale momentum by recent vol to prefer stable winners. Confidence 0.7 because volatility scaling often improves Sharpe.

results.idea: Risk-adjusted return (information ratio) 60d
results.description: S1: uses ts_ir to combine mean and std (single field); S2 not applied; S3 not needed; S4 applied. TS IR highlights instruments with high risk-adjusted recent performance. Confidence 0.66.

results.idea: Idiosyncratic momentum: return minus factor (industry) 20d
results.description: S1: combined stock returns and industry return; S2 not applied; S3 not needed (both have coverage=1.0); S4 used. Captures stock performance relative to industry. Confidence 0.63.

results.idea: Momentum crossover: 60d vs 20d
results.description: S1: uses same return field at two horizons; S2 not applied; S3 not needed; S4 used. Trend confirmation via longer vs shorter zscore difference. Confidence 0.6.

results.idea: Factor timing via ts_corr with a leading factor
results.description: S1: uses correlation between returns and a factor (high userCount factor rsk62_factor_1_100_val100); S2 not applied; S3 not needed; S4 used. Low correlation may signal idiosyncratic opportunity. Confidence 0.58.

results.idea: Earnings momentum (SPE) 90d
results.description: S1: uses earnings per share risk field rsk62_risk_spe; S2 not applied; S3 not needed (coverage ~0.961); S4 used (moderate userCount). Earnings momentum captures fundamental acceleration. Confidence 0.61.

results.idea: Growth vs Value spread (eps growth minus PB)
results.description: S1: combines growth and book-value (pb) signals; S2 not applied; S3 unnecessary; S4 used (both fields have high userCount). Capture stocks with growth beating value peers. Confidence 0.59.

results.idea: Liquidity breakout: log(adv20) momentum
results.description: S1: uses liquidity metric rsk62_risk_logadv20; S2 not applied; S3 not needed (coverage high); S4 used. Rising liquidity often precedes price moves. Confidence 0.56.

results.idea: Low idiosyncratic volatility preference
results.description: S1: uses specific risk rsk62_1_100_ksrs to prefer low idiosyncratic risk; S2 not applied; S3 not needed (coverage ~0.988); S4 used. Low-specific-risk stocks may provide more reliable momentum. Confidence 0.6.

results.idea: Beta-adjusted momentum (normalize by beta to market factor)
results.description: S1: combines return and beta_factor_logcap; S2 not applied; S3 not required; S4 used (beta has high userCount). Adjust momentum by exposure to size factor. Confidence 0.62.

results.idea: Short-term mean-reversion scaled by volatility
results.description: S1: uses returns and volatility; S2 not applied; S3 not needed; S4 used. Prefer mean reversion when volatility is low to reduce noise. Confidence 0.57.

results.idea: Cross-sectional return zscore trimmed (winsorized)
results.description: S1: single return field; S2 not applied; S3 not needed; S4 used. Winsorize to reduce outliers before ranking. Confidence 0.6.

results.idea: Momentum weighted by intercept (factor intercept as stability proxy)
results.description: S1: uses returns and factor intercept rsk62_1_100_intercept; S2 not applied; S3 not needed; S4 used (intercept high userCount). Penalize stocks with unstable intercepts. Confidence 0.6.

results.idea: Short-term breakout using retseries vector average (vec_avg)
results.description: S1: used retseries vector field; S2 applied (vec_avg on retseries); S3 not needed (retseries coverage=1.0); S4 moderate. Using vec_avg smooths intraday/series behavior. Confidence 0.58.

results.idea: Factor momentum using factor return series average
results.description: S1: uses factor retseries; S2 applied; S3 not needed; S4 used. Captures factor strength and its influence on stocks. Confidence 0.6.

results.idea: Short-term ts_rank in time (3d)
results.description: S1: time-series rank of returns; S2 not applied; S3 not needed; S4 used. TS rank highlights recent relative change. Confidence 0.54.

results.idea: Momentum tempered by gross margin quality
results.description: S1: combines returns and gross margin beta/backfill fields; S2 not applied; S3 not needed (high coverage); S4 used. Prefer momentum in stocks with improving margins. Confidence 0.59.

results.idea: Beta divergence vs industry (beta - industry beta)
results.description: S1: uses instrument beta and industry-level beta (coverage of industry beta may be <0.6); S2 not applied; S3 applied for lower-coverage industry beta via ts_backfill when needed; S4 used. Diverging beta can signal mispricing. Confidence 0.53.

results.idea: Short-term cross-sectional volatility rank (low vol preference)
results.description: S1: uses volatility date-index field; S2 not applied; S3 not required; S4: vol_di high userCount. Prefer low-vol stocks cross-sectionally. Confidence 0.6.

results.idea: Momentum minus industry momentum (residual momentum)
results.description: S1: uses returns and industry retseries; S2 not applied; S3 not needed; S4 used. Residual momentum often isolates stock-specific moves. Confidence 0.64.

results.idea: Short-term reversal where liquidity low (contrarian with low liquidity filter)
results.description: S1: returns and logadv20 used; S2 not applied; S3 not needed; S4 used. Apply contrarian only when liquidity low to exploit temporary mispricing. Confidence 0.52.

results.idea: Earnings-quality momentum (nipe)
results.description: S1: uses net income per employee (nipe) backfill field; S2 not applied; S3 not required (coverage high for backfill fields); S4 used. Fundamental momentum in profitability metrics. Confidence 0.58.

results.idea: Volatility breakout: rising volatility then momentum
results.description: S1: combines returns and volatility; S2 not applied; S3 not needed; S4 used. Favor stocks with rising volatility and positive momentum (capture expansion). Confidence 0.55.

results.idea: Momentum weighted by low beta (prefer low market exposure)
results.description: S1: combines returns and beta_factor_pb; S2 not applied; S3 not required; S4 used. Reduce market risk by preferring low-beta winners. Confidence 0.6.

results.idea: Factor residual: returns minus factor exposure times factor return
results.description: S1: uses return, beta_factor_mtl (momentum) and factor return; limitation: use two datafields to respect KEEP_IN_MIND2; S2 not applied; S3 not needed. Build residual using beta*factor and subtract. Confidence 0.61.

results.idea: Cross-sectional current ratio quality filter on momentum
results.description: S1: combines short-term momentum and current ratio backfill; S2 not applied; S3 not required; S4 used. Favor momentum in stocks with strong liquidity ratios. Confidence 0.57.

results.idea: Momentum in low-intercept stocks (stability proxy)
results.description: S1: return and intercept fields; S2 not applied; S3 not needed; S4 used. Penalize stocks with high intercept instability. Confidence 0.59.

results.idea: Momentum scaled by market cap (logcap)
results.description: S1: returns and logcap beta used; S2 not applied; S3 not needed; S4 used. Prefer momentum in mid/small caps by scaling. Confidence 0.58.

results.idea: Short-term momentum filtered by earnings surprise date-index
results.description: S1: returns and id_spe fields; S2 not applied; S3 not needed; S4 used. Emphasize momentum around earnings events. Confidence 0.56.

results.idea: Trend strength via ts_ir on factor returns
results.description: S1: uses ts_ir on factor return series (factor_5_100_val55 has high alphaCount); S2 not applied; S3 not needed; S4 applied. Factor IR indicates sustained factor. Confidence 0.6.

results.idea: Cross-sectional rank of recent drawdown (ts_max_diff)
results.description: S1: uses ts_max_diff on returns; S2 not applied; S3 not required; S4 used. Identify recoveries after drawdowns. Confidence 0.54.

results.idea: Momentum tempered by specific risk (ksrs)
results.description: S1: returns and specific risks used; S2 not applied; S3 not needed; S4 used. Penalize momentum where idiosyncratic risk is high. Confidence 0.62.

results.idea: Factor mean reversion: recent factor return negative zscore
results.description: S1: single factor return field; S2 not applied; S3 not needed; S4 used. Mean-reversion on factor returns for tactical exposure. Confidence 0.5.

results.idea: Momentum combined with dividend yield strength
results.description: S1: returns and dividend date-index used; S2 not applied; S3 not required; S4 used. Prefer momentum in dividend-paying improving names. Confidence 0.55.

results.idea: Sector-relative momentum (stock vs sector retseries)
results.description: S1: stock returns vs industry retseries; S2 not applied; S3 not needed; S4 used. Capture stock outperformance within sector. Confidence 0.63.

results.idea: Short-term momentum with hump smoothing (reduce turnover)
results.description: S1: returns only; S2 not applied; S3 not needed; S4 used. Apply hump to limit turnover and noise. Confidence 0.6.

results.idea: Mean-reversion on factor exposure (beta) shifts
results.description: S1: uses beta time-series; S2 not applied; S3 applied when using lower-coverage industry betas via ts_backfill; S4 used. Reversion in betas can indicate risk re-pricing. Confidence 0.52.

results.idea: Momentum in low-current-ratio stocks (risk-on preference)
results.description: S1: combines returns and current ratio; S2 not applied; S3 not required; S4 used. Favor momentum in more leveraged/liquid-constrained names for higher returns. Confidence 0.5.

results.idea: Momentum filtered by log(cap) date-index (size timing)
results.description: S1: returns and logcap di used; S2 not applied; S3 not required; S4 used. Apply momentum only to stocks with desired size profile. Confidence 0.56.

results.idea: Cross-sectional zscore of beta to growth (beta_growth)
results.description: S1: beta to growth and growth di; S2 not applied; S3 not needed; S4 applied. High beta to growth may signal vulnerability; use cross-sectional zscore. Confidence 0.54.

results.idea: Momentum tilt toward low PB (value-momentum hybrid)
results.description: S1: returns and pb backfill field; S2 not applied; S3 not necessary; S4 used. Combine momentum with value tilt. Confidence 0.6.

results.idea: Momentum persistence test via ts_product of signs
results.description: S1: uses ts_product of short returns to measure persistence; S2 not applied; S3 not needed; S4 used. Product of recent sign indicates persistent trend. Confidence 0.52.

results.idea: Short-term momentum scaled by factor intercept (stability)
results.description: S1: returns and factor intercept; S2 not applied; S3 not required; S4 used. Prefer momentum where intercept indicates stable factor fit. Confidence 0.58.

results.idea: Cross-sectional rank of ts_kurtosis of returns (fat tails)
results.description: S1: uses ts_kurtosis on return series; S2 not applied; S3 not needed; S4 used. Penalize extreme kurtosis to avoid tail-risk. Confidence 0.5.

results.idea: Momentum combined with margin improvement signal
results.description: S1: returns and gross margin backfill used; S2 not applied; S3 used for backfill fields if needed; S4 used. Favor momentum where margins improving. Confidence 0.59.

results.idea: Short-term reversal in high specific risk names
results.description: S1: returns and ksrs; S2 not applied; S3 not needed; S4 used. Contrarian in high idiosyncratic-risk stocks could capture temporary mispricings. Confidence 0.51.

results.idea: Factor momentum blend (average of multiple factor retseries via vec_avg)
results.description: S1: uses vec_avg on factor retseries fields (vector type); SUGGESTION2 applied; S3 not needed; S4 chosen factors with high alphaCount where possible. Blend reduces idiosyncratic factor noise. Confidence 0.62.

results.idea: Momentum scaled by industry volatility (favor stable industries)
results.description: S1: returns and industry retseries used; S2 not applied; S3 not needed; S4 used. Penalize momentum in volatile industries. Confidence 0.57.

results.idea: Cross-sectional ts_count_nans (data stability) filter on alpha
results.description: S1: uses ts_count_nans on factor retseries to avoid unstable data; S2 applied where vector; S3 not required; S4 applied. Exclude noisy instruments with many NaNs. Confidence 0.55.

results.idea: Momentum combined with dividend strength filter
results.description: S1: returns and dividend_di used; S2 not applied; S3 not required; S4 used. Prefer momentum when dividends recently announced. Confidence 0.56.

results.idea: Volatility contraction breakout: low vol then rising returns
results.description: S1: returns and volatility di used; S2 not applied; S3 not required; S4 used. Seek breakouts after volatility compression. Confidence 0.58.

results.idea: Momentum with winsorized factor exposure
results.description: S1: returns and factor beta; S2 not applied; S3 not needed; S4 used. Winsorize beta to reduce distortions. Confidence 0.6.

results.idea: Cross-sectional zscore of recent return volatility (prefer stable winners)
results.description: S1: uses ts_std_dev of returns; S2 not applied; S3 not necessary; S4 used. Prefer winners with low realized vol. Confidence 0.6.

results.idea: Momentum signal de-noised by ts_decay_linear
results.description: S1: returns only; S2 not applied; S3 not needed; S4 used. Use ts_decay_linear to emphasize recent returns while smoothing. Confidence 0.61.

results.idea: Cross-sectional momentum normalized to intercept (stability)
results.description: S1: returns and intercept; S2 not applied; S3 not required; S4 used. Normalize by intercept to control factor exposure. Confidence 0.59.

results.idea: Momentum combined with low beta to banks (bank exposure avoidance)
results.description: S1: returns and bank beta used; S2 not applied; S3 not required; S4 used. Avoid banking exposure in momentum book. Confidence 0.57.

results.idea: Momentum based on factor retseries quantile transform
results.description: S1: uses retseries factor (vec-type) and ts_quantile to gaussianize; S2 applied; S3 not needed; S4 used. Quantile transform produces better-behaved alphas. Confidence 0.6.

results.idea: Cross-sectional zscore of net income per employee momentum
results.description: S1: uses nipe date-index/backfill; S2 not applied; S3 not required; S4 used. Fundamental momentum in productivity metric. Confidence 0.58.

results.idea: Momentum multiplied by low industry beta (prefer stocks with low industry exposure)
results.description: S1: returns and industry beta (may have coverage <0.6) - S3 applied if needed; S4 considered. Reduce industry-driven bets. Confidence 0.55.

results.idea: Momentum combined with improving debt/equity (qe2d) profile
results.description: S1: returns and debt-to-equity backfill; S2 not applied; S3 not necessary (backfill coverage high); S4 used. Prefer momentum in deleveraging firms. Confidence 0.57.

results.idea: Momentum trimmed by ts_count_nans of factor exposures (data robustness)
results.description: S1: returns and retseries factor; S2 applied for vector; S3 not needed; S4 used. Exclude instruments with unstable factor histories. Confidence 0.56.

results.idea: Momentum with ts_scale normalization (time-space scaling)
results.description: S1: returns only; S2 not applied; S3 not needed; S4 used. TS scaling reduces effects of differing recent ranges. Confidence 0.6.

results.idea: Cross-sectional rank of industry return momentum (industry leaders)
results.description: S1: industry retseries; S2 not applied; S3 not needed; S4 used. Identify industries with momentum and prefer stocks within them. Confidence 0.58.

results.idea: Factor exposure momentum using beta to growth
results.description: S1: beta to growth and returns; S2 not applied; S3 not required; S4 used. Favor stocks increasing exposure to growth factor with positive returns. Confidence 0.55.

results.idea: Momentum penalized by high beta to volatility (avoid volatility-loaded names)
results.description: S1: returns and beta to volatility; S2 not applied; S3 not required; S4 used. Reduce risk by penalizing volatility exposure. Confidence 0.59.

results.idea: Short-term momentum using vec_sum of recent intraday-like series
results.description: S1: uses retseries vector and vec_sum to aggregate; S2 applied; S3 not needed; S4 used. Aggregating series may capture burst moves. Confidence 0.54.

results.idea: Momentum with ts_arg_max freshness penalty
results.description: S1: returns only; S2 not applied; S3 not required; S4 used. Penalize signals where the recent max is too old (freshness). Confidence 0.53.

results.idea: Momentum enhanced by low book-to-price (value tilt)
results.description: S1: returns and pb backfill; S2 not applied; S3 not required; S4 used. Combine momentum with deep value (low PB) tilt. Confidence 0.6.

results.idea: Momentum combined with short-term product of returns (persistence)
results.description: S1: returns only; S2 not applied; S3 not needed; S4 used. Use ts_product to measure consecutive positive returns. Confidence 0.52.

results.idea: Mean reversion based on ts_av_diff (deviation from mean)
results.description: S1: returns only; S2 not applied; S3 not needed; S4 used. ts_av_diff measures deviation from recent mean; reverse for reversion. Confidence 0.55.

results.idea: Factor momentum minus market return (idiosyncratic factor alpha)
results.description: S1: factor return and market return; S2 not applied; S3 not required; S4 used. Isolate factor-specific momentum ignoring market moves. Confidence 0.58.

results.idea: Momentum with group neutralization by industry intercept (use intercept as proxy)
results.description: S1: returns and intercept; S2 not applied; S3 not needed; S4 used. Use factor intercept to approximate group neutrality. Avoid direct GROUP operator to respect KEEP_IN_MIND4. Confidence 0.54.

results.idea: Momentum higher when factor IR strong (ts_ir of factor)
results.description: S1: combine stock momentum with factor ts_ir; S2 not applied; S3 not required; S4 used. Increase weight when factor is consistent. Confidence 0.6.

results.idea: Short-term reversal following extreme ts_quantile events
results.description: S1: returns only; S2 not applied; S3 not required; S4 used. Use ts_quantile to detect extremes and reverse. Confidence 0.53.

results.idea: Momentum with volatility IR adjustment (ts_ir on volatility)
results.description: S1: returns and volatility IR; S2 not applied; S3 not needed; S4 used. Penalize momentum when volatility IR indicates unstable vol regime. Confidence 0.56.

results.idea: Momentum using ts_arg_min (fresh lows mean-revert)
results.description: S1: returns only; S2 not applied; S3 not required; S4 used. Buy stocks at fresh local minima expecting bounce. Confidence 0.5.

results.idea: Composite alpha: average of short and medium momentum
results.description: S1: returns only combined across horizons; S2 not applied; S3 not needed; S4 used. Combining horizons often smooths signal. Confidence 0.62.

results.idea: Momentum adjusted by debt-to-equity (qe2d) beta exposure
results.description: S1: returns and qe2d beta; S2 not applied; S3 not necessary; S4 used. Reduce momentum where debt exposure high. Confidence 0.56.

results.idea: Momentum diluted by high group intercept (proxy for common moves)
results.description: S1: returns and industry intercept; S2 not applied; S3 not needed; S4 used. Reduce alpha where intercept large (common movement). Confidence 0.55.

results.idea: Momentum using ts_delay (lagged confirmation)
results.description: S1: returns only; S2 not applied; S3 not needed; S4 used. Require momentum persists after lag to confirm trend. Confidence 0.57.

results.idea: Cross-sectional low-volatility factor: rank of beta to volatility
results.description: S1: beta to volatility field used; S2 not applied; S3 not required; S4 used. Low beta_to_vol names preferred. Confidence 0.58.

results.idea: Momentum combined with improving gross margin (di)
results.description: S1: returns and margin date-index used; S2 not applied; S3 not needed; S4 used. Fundamental improvement supporting price moves. Confidence 0.57.

results.idea: Momentum on factor returns averaged (vec_avg) across factors
results.description: S1: uses vec_avg on retseries of factors; S2 applied; S3 not required; S4: selected factor series with high alphaCount. Averaging reduces noise. Confidence 0.62.

results.idea: Short-term reversal with ts_step (recentness weighting)
results.description: S1: returns and ts_step to emphasize recent days; S2 not applied; S3 not needed; S4 used. Weight recent extremes more heavily for reversion. Confidence 0.52.

results.idea: Momentum with low kurtosis preference (stable tails)
results.description: S1: returns only with ts_kurtosis used to penalize fat tails; S2 not applied; S3 not required; S4 used. Lower kurtosis preferred for reliability. Confidence 0.53.

results.idea: Momentum scaled by logadv20 beta (liquidity-adjusted)
results.description: S1: returns and logadv20 beta used; S2 not applied; S3 not needed; S4 high userCount for logadv20. Adjust momentum for liquidity exposure. Confidence 0.6.

results.idea: Contrarian on factor overreaction (ts_zscore factor short-term)
results.description: S1: factor return short-term zscore; S2 not applied; S3 not needed; S4 used. Short-term factor reversals can be exploited. Confidence 0.5.

results.idea: Momentum with winsorized returns to reduce outliers
results.description: S1: single return field winsorized then ranked; S2 not applied; S3 not needed; S4 used. Winsorization reduces extreme impact. Confidence 0.6.

results.idea: Momentum combined with improving net income per employee (nipe_di)
results.description: S1: returns and nipe date-index used; S2 not applied; S3 not needed; S4 used. Prefer momentum where NIPE shows positive trend. Confidence 0.57.

results.idea: Momentum adjusted by beta to short-term momentum factor (avoid crowded momentum exposure)
results.description: S1: returns and beta_mts used; S2 not applied; S3 not required; S4 used. Penalize names with high exposure to crowded short-term momentum factor. Confidence 0.58.

results.idea: Momentum scaled by inverse of volatility date-index (stability)
results.description: S1: returns and volatility di used; S2 not applied; S3 not required; S4 used. Favor momentum in stable names. Confidence 0.6.

results.idea: Momentum with ts_regression residual vs factor (idiosyncratic alpha)
results.description: S1: returns and factor used via ts_regression (y=returns, x=factor); S2 not applied; S3 not needed; S4 used. Use regression residuals as alpha. Confidence 0.61.

results.idea: Momentum combined with improving roe proxy (use growth di)
results.description: S1: returns and growth date-index used; S2 not applied; S3 not required; S4 used. Favor momentum where growth metrics improving. Confidence 0.58.

results.idea: Cross-sectional ts_arg_max on factor returns (recent factor peaks)
results.description: S1: factor retseries used; S2 applied if vector; S3 not needed; S4 used. Identify factors at peaks for tactical adjustments. Confidence 0.52.

results.idea: Momentum with hump + ts_decay to jointly smooth and emphasize
results.description: S1: returns only; S2 not applied; S3 not required; S4 used. Both operators reduce turnover and emphasize recent info. Confidence 0.62.

results.idea: Momentum scaled by inverse of ksrs (prefer low specific risk winners)
results.description: S1: returns and ksrs used; S2 not applied; S3 not required; S4 used. Lower idiosyncratic risk increases signal reliability. Confidence 0.61.

results.idea: Cross-sectional ranking of factor beta to PB (value exposure)
results.description: S1: beta_pb used; S2 not applied; S3 not necessary; S4 used. Identify names with extreme value exposure. Confidence 0.53.

results.idea: Momentum with ts_covariance to a factor (tilt away from high covariance)
results.description: S1: returns and factor used; S2 not applied; S3 not required; S4 used. Penalize stocks with high covariance to unwanted factor. Confidence 0.57.

results.idea: Short-term reversal when sector momentum negative
results.description: S1: returns and industry retseries used; S2 not applied; S3 not needed; S4 used. Contrarian within sectors lagging overall market. Confidence 0.52.

results.idea: Momentum using ts_rank in time combined with cross-sectional zscore
results.description: S1: returns only; S2 not applied; S3 not required; S4 used. Combine time and cross-sectional ranking for robustness. Confidence 0.6.

results.idea: Momentum scaled by beta to dividend (avoid dividend-driven momentum)
results.description: S1: returns and beta_dividend used; S2 not applied; S3 not necessary; S4 used. Reduce exposure to dividend-driven artifacts. Confidence 0.56.

results.idea: Momentum weighted by group mean proxy (subtract industry mean retseries)
results.description: S1: returns and industry retseries used; S2 not applied; S3 not needed; S4 used. Subtract industry mean to focus on idiosyncratic momentum while avoiding GROUP operator. Confidence 0.63.

results.idea: Momentum with ts_scale and winsorize (robust scaling)
results.description: S1: returns only; S2 not applied; S3 not needed; S4 used. Scale in time-space and winsorize to improve stability. Confidence 0.61.

results.idea: Momentum adjusted by beta to internet industry (avoid internet-driven crowdedness)
results.description: S1: returns and industry beta to internet (coverage ~0.564) used; S2 not applied; S3 applied if coverage low via ts_backfill; S4 used. Penalize internet exposure. Confidence 0.55.

results.idea: Momentum augmented by low beta to banks (safe momentum)
results.description: S1: returns and beta_banks used; S2 not applied; S3 not needed; S4 used (beta_banks high userCount). Favor winners with low bank exposure. Confidence 0.58.

results.idea: Momentum with ts_count_nans as stability multiplier (few NaNs preferred)
results.description: S1: returns and retseries; S2 applied to retseries where vector; S3 not necessary; S4 used. Penalize instruments with many NaNs in history. Confidence 0.56.

results.idea: Momentum using ts_quantile to create uniform ranks
results.description: S1: returns only; S2 not applied; S3 not needed; S4 used. ts_quantile gives normalized ranks for downstream processing. Confidence 0.6.

results.idea: Momentum combined with low industry-specific expected returns (betas)
results.description: S1: returns and beta_industry_expectation used; S2 not applied; S3 applied for low-coverage industry betas via ts_backfill when needed; S4 used. Avoid industries with high expected returns (crowded). Confidence 0.54.

results.idea: Momentum with ts_delay confirmation (lagged momentum check)
results.description: S1: returns only; S2 not applied; S3 not necessary; S4 used. Confirm momentum persists after a delay to reduce false signals. Confidence 0.59.

results.idea: Momentum with vec_stddev of retseries (cross-factor dispersion)
results.description: S1: factor retseries vector; S2 applied (vec_stddev); S3 not needed; S4 used. High dispersion across factor components can signal opportunities. Confidence 0.58.

results.idea: Momentum with group proxy via industry intercept subtraction
results.description: S1: returns and industry intercept; S2 not applied; S3 not required; S4 used. Subtract industry intercept as a lightweight group-neutralization respecting KEEP_IN_MIND4. Confidence 0.6.

results.idea: Momentum amplified when factor IR high and industry vol low
results.description: S1: uses factor IR and industry retseries volatility; S2 not applied; S3 not needed; S4 used. Combine signals to overweight reliable environments. Confidence 0.61.

results.idea: Short-term reversal for very low logadv20 (illiquid bounce)
results.description: S1: returns and logadv20 fields; S2 not applied; S3 not required; S4 used. Contrarian in illiquid names after short-term drops. Confidence 0.5.

results.idea: Momentum with winsorized beta exposures
results.description: S1: returns and beta exposures; S2 not applied; S3 not needed; S4 used. Winsorize betas to limit extreme adjustment impact. Confidence 0.59.

results.idea: Momentum using ts_scale across time windows to normalize
results.description: S1: returns only; S2 not applied; S3 not needed; S4 used. TS scaling across multiple windows ensures comparability. Confidence 0.6.

results.idea: Momentum with ts_decay tuned to target turnover (ts_target_tvr_decay)
results.description: S1: returns only; S2 not applied; S3 not required; S4 used. Use ts_target_tvr_decay to meet turnover constraints. Confidence 0.6.

results.idea: Composite: combine factor vec_avg and stock return zscore
results.description: S1: uses vec_avg of factor retseries and stock returns (two datafields max); S2 applied for factor vec; S3 not needed; S4 used. Blend factor trend with stock momentum. Confidence 0.63.

results.idea: Momentum with trailing mean deviation (ts_av_diff) confirmation
results.description: S1: returns only; S2 not applied; S3 not needed; S4 used. Require positive deviation from trailing mean to confirm momentum. Confidence 0.6.

results.idea: Momentum limited to names with low ts_count_nans in factor history
results.description: S1: returns and factor retseries; S2 applied for vector; S3 not required; S4 used. Ensure data robustness by excluding names with many NaNs. Confidence 0.57.

results.idea: Momentum with ts_regression slope persistence filter
results.description: S1: returns and factor via ts_regression; S2 not applied; S3 not needed; S4 used. Use regression slope to confirm persistence of factor relationships. Confidence 0.59.
